name: Identify all above ground and underground services and disconnection certificate to be obtained from builder prior to commencement.
Any underground services to remain must be located, tagged and/or marked. Any live services within 2m of pile must be isolated.
Obtain excavation permit and conduct Toolbox Talk to inform Operators if there are any live services.
Commencement of Works - Planning / Product Approvals
Conforming product selection (concrete mix and reo)
Approval of drawings or reports by builder
Gridlines provided to building perimeter only and mark out.
For positional tolerances, cut-off levels, dimensional tolerances, straightness and inclination, conform to AS 2159 Section 7.2.
Peg the position of each pile and establish a grid of recovery pegs to enable the setting out to be checked
Pile diameter as specified [Refer to the piling schedule for numbering and each individual pile detail]
Level and compact the piling platform to ensure sufficient bearing capacity for piling rigs to travel, install steel plate or piling mat if required.
Geotechnical engineer to determine the bearing capacity of work platform and sign off
Drill piers as per the specifications, alignment and tolerances, ensuring minimum depth as specified by drawings
Cover open pier holes for safety
Determine the depth of rock RL of each pile
Excavation complete - Correct position, diameter, profile and correct socket length
Certificate of compliance for reinforcement for each batch
Provide spacers on the reinforcement cage to maintain the correct cover. During installation of reinforcement in cased holes keep the reinforcement cage clear of the sides of the hole.
Ensure correct reinforcement projection is provided.
Three Concrete cylinders specimen to conduct compressive strength test after 7 days and 28 days.
Strength grade/Characteristic compressive strength to be submitted when available.
Site engineer or supervisor to check the concrete delivery dockets to ensure the correct concrete mix.
Concrete cannot be poured if it exceeds the allowable waiting hours
Pour concrete to reinforced pier [Refer to the piling schedule for numbering and each individual pile detail]
Record actual pile heights on pile schedule
Commencement of Works - Planning / Product Approvals
Project Quality Plan conforming to requirements in specifications
Construction joint at top of pile shall cleaned and trimmed to the correct levels
Capping Beam dimensions are per the drawings
Inspect Formwork prior to placing reinforcement
Specifications, shape, size and grade as per drawings
Surface condition – free of loose mill scale, rust, oil, grease, mud or other material which would reduce the bond between the reinforcement and concrete.
Starter bars cast into pile caps shall be accurately set out and securely held in correct position during concrete placement
Inspect reinforcement prior to pouring concrete
Strength grade/Characteristic compressive strength to be submitted when available:
Before placing concrete, remove free water, dust, debris and stains from the forms and the formed space
Do not disturb forms until concrete is cured and hard enough to withstand it.
Inspect the capping beam and check the levels
Commencement of Works - Planning / Product Approvals
Conforming data and method of working.
Prepare vertical face of excavation between piers and clean down faces of piers
Drill into face of pier and epoxy fix steel bars
Install strip drains for each panel
Strength grade/Characteristic compressive strength to be submitted when available:
Spray Shotcrete per the drawings to face and Maintain straight face
